subject: Re: [junit] is it a bad manner?
msgSnippet: ... I suppose this is another area where we diverge; I don t use an RDBMS as a simple object store. Thus, my mappings between in-memory objects and relations
messageBody:
On Thu, 29 Jul 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> You seem to be describing freezing schemas. I am not. I am
> talking about freezing the persistence mechanism--the O/R mapping
> technology--and reusing it across applications.

I suppose this is another area where we diverge; I don't use an RDBMS as
a simple object store. Thus, my "mappings" between in-memory objects and
relations in the database often need custom code.

cjs

Curt Sampson <cjs@...> +81 90 7737 2974 http://www.NetBSD.org
Don't you know, in this new Dark Age, we're all light. --XTC
